content.raw:
I will try to push some more details on the expected answers for the test. 
However ( in the context of solving #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1278/support-fixed-joint-types-in-gazebo ) I am working on a more parametric test [1] for Joint::GetForceTorque() implementations, so we can avoid difficult to read hardcoded expected answers. Feel free to provide any feedback also on that. 

[1] https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/gazebo-fork/commits/09b8a0d176de82a792025e3ca8641f7f45dd0796?at=default#chg-test/integration/joint_get_force_torque.cc
content.html:
I will try to push some more details on the expected answers for the test. However ( in the context of solving #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1278/support-fixed-joint-types-in-gazebo ) I am working on a more parametric test [1] for Joint::GetForceTorque() implementations, so we can avoid difficult to read hardcoded expected answers. Feel free to provide any feedback also on that.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/gazebo-fork/commits/09b8a0d176de82a792025e3ca8641f7f45dd0796?at=default#chg-test/integration/joint_get_force_torque.cc
